name: AFC Bournemouth History Quiz | UK Football Teams | 10 Questions

questions.text: What was the team that became AFC Bournemouth called, when they were formed?
questions.explanation:
Boscombe.

	Boscombe FC were formed in 1899, and entered the Bounemouth and District Junior League. In 1923, they changed their name to Bournemouth & Boscombe, and it wasn't until 48 years later in 1971, when they became known as AFC Bournemouth.

questions.text: Where did the club first play as their home ground?
questions.explanation:
Castlemain Road.

	Upon formation, the club played at Castlemain Road, and moved to Kings Road in 1902, and stayed there for 8 years until a local businessman named J.E. Cooper-Dean, leased a piece of land next to Kings Road, on which they built Dean Court, named after the benefactor, where they played until moving into the Fitness First Stadium in 2001.

questions.text: Who was the club's first manager?
questions.explanation:
Vincent Kitcher.

	Kitcher managed the club between 1914-1923.

questions.text: Which of the following players once scored 9 goals in a game for the club?
questions.explanation:
Ted MacDougall.

	MacDougall scored 9 goals in an 11-0 victory over Margate, in the FA Cup first round on 20th November 1971. In 1973, he signed for Manchester United and played there for one season, before moving on to a host of other clubs.

questions.text: Bournemouth won a divisional title in the 20th century?
questions.explanation:
True.

	Bournemouth finished as champions of the then third division, in season 1986-87 with 97 points from 46 games. This was the only time in the 20th century that they were champions of any division.

questions.text: Which year saw George Best play for the club?
questions.explanation:
1983.

	The legend is that George Best, appeared in four games for Bournemouth towards the end of the 1983 season.

questions.text: What did Bournemouth achieve in 1992 that made history?
questions.correct: First club to win an FA Cup tie live on television by way of penalties
options: Bought a player and sold him the next day
Had every player sent off in a league game
Had ten different managers in the one season
questions.explanation:
First club to win an FA Cup tie live on television by way of penalties.

	After the original game had ended a 0-0 draw at Dean Court, Newcastle United were the home team for the replay on January 22, 1992, that finished 2-2 after extra-time. Bournemouth won the game 4-3 on penalties.

questions.text: From which club did Bournemouth sign Warren Feeney in 2001?
questions.explanation:
Leeds United.

	Feeney never played a game for Leeds during 1998-2001, and originally signed for Bournemouth on loan, but made the move permanent just two months later.

questions.text: In 1956-1957, Bournemouth set their record attendance at Dean Court. Who was it against?
questions.explanation:
Manchester United.

	28,799 fans attended the quarter-final game against Manchester United on March 2, 1957, in which United won 2-1 and went on to lose by the same score to Aston Villa in the final.

questions.text: Which manager signed Jamie Redknapp for Liverpool from Bournemouth?
questions.explanation:
Graeme Souness & Souness.

	Redknapp was sold to Liverpool on January 16, 1991, after only 13 league games for Bournemouth.
